One techno-thriller novel that fits your description is "Ghost in the Wires" by S.M. Stirling, which is not as well-known as some others in the genre but still delivers an exciting story. Please note that "Ghost in the Wires" is not a conventional techno-thriller as it is part of the "Emberverse" series, a post-apocalyptic fantasy world, but the central character, Sam, is a hacker who uses his skills to spread malware and infiltrate computer systems.

In "Ghost in the Wires," Sam is a gifted computer hacker who finds himself in a post-apocalyptic world after a catastrophic event known as the Change. The story revolves around Sam's efforts to keep his skills and knowledge secret while navigating a dangerous landscape filled with new challenges and adversaries. Although the main focus of the book is survival in the post-apocalyptic world, there are several tech-driven subplots and scenes that may appeal to those interested in cybersecurity and malware.

5. Testing: Sam would need to test the script on a test system or virtual environment to ensure it is functioning as expected and successfully compromises the targeted systems without being detected.

6. Deployment: After successfully testing the script, Sam would deploy it, either manually or using automated tools, to compromise the target systems. Depending on the nature of the attack and the desired level of stealth, the script might be triggered immediately or scheduled to run at a later time.
